page.title: 19THE FORESTER TODAY 1
page.content: Mr Leemans,Forestry Commission area Head Forester was interviewed . {Acid Rain & Dutch Elm Disease?}There are no signs of D.Elm Disease but we are still not sure about Acid Rain.{ {Tools?}Most are mechanical-we don't use axes & handsaws now-we use chain saws & tractors{Do you like the job? I like working outside & the freedom of choice although I spend more time in the office today.I have done the jo b for 32 years.I supervise the work fo rce.Commission founded in 1919 & plant began here in 1924{Animals?}A wide ran ge in the forest eg deer,stoats,foxes, weasels & many birds.Control is needed Deer damage trees in the breeding seas on & rub the velvet off their antlers. A cull each yr.Rabbits are controlled but foxes do more good than harm{Type {of tree?}Mainly Scots Pine,Larch,Dougl las Fir+Spruce+some hardwood.Smaller
